intro: Tephroseris besseriana, commonly known as the white sand lily, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
